bibdata.title: IEEE Standard for a High-Performance Serial Bus
Redline
IEEE Standard for a High-Performance Serial Bus - Redline
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Std 1394-2008 (Revision of IEEE Std 1394-1995) - Redline

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: This standard provides specifications for a high-speed serial bus that supports both asynchronous and isochronous communication and integrates well with most IEEE standard 32-bit and 64-bit parallel buses. It is intended to provide a low-cost interconnect between cards on the same backplane, cards on other backplanes, and external peripherals. Interfaces to longer distance transmission media [such as unshielded twisted pair (UTP), optical fiber, and plastic optical fiber (POF)] allow the interconnection to be extended throughout a local network. This standard follows the command and status register (CSR) architecture of IEEE Std 1212-2001.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
